titleStmt.title: Letter, James Dodds in France to Ellen Smith in Jackson, Tenn.,1919 June 2

publicationStmt.publisher: The University of Tennessee Libraries Digital Initiatives

availability.p: The copyright interests in this collection remain with the creator. For more information, contact the Special Collections Library.

bibl.title: Letter, James Dodds in France to Ellen Smith in Jackson, Tenn.,1919 June 2

projectDesc.p: Machine-readable transcription created for the University of Tennessee Libraries Special Collections.

editorialDecl.p: Errors in transcription of the printed text not controlled.
Editorial tags limited to gap and unclear.
Catchwords and directional notes such as "turn page over" have been omitted.

revisionDesc.change: Approximate date of original transcription and transcriber.
Migrating from P4 to validated TEI P5.

div.p: I received a letter from you last week and as usual was glad to here from you I have moved from Langres to this place since I wrote you last
Have been here three days expect to leave tomorrow for Le Mans. We are at last getting ready to start home.
Have turned in all of our trucks. So I guess the next thing I will be drilling Well I sure will hate to see
that for I do hate drill But if I have to do it to get home here goes.

I guess we will be over here at least three weeks yet. I dont know how long will be in Le Mans but when we leave thair will go to Brest, for boat will have to stay in Brest a week or ten days waiting for boat
Well it is to hard for me to figure so will stop I will be discharged at Fort Oglethorp Ga.
Think will stay of in Nashville a day to see some of may peoples Then will head for Jaxon in a hurry.
I will tell you the French that is in that letter as soon as get home
No thair isnt a Chance of me bringing a French bride back with me. Ask Linn he will tell you what most of the Amex boys think of the French Girls
Well I have run out of news for this time Hope to See you Soon
